message.content:
cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CYBER, cs.MA 

The paper focuses on the design of adaptive human-centred HMIs for industrial machines and robots, which involves the measurement of user's capabilities, adaptation of the information presented in the HMI, and training of the user. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of automation technologies in manufacturing processes, which suggests that it could also belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) categories. The paper also mentions the need for cybersecurity in manufacturing systems, which suggests that it could belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) category. Finally, the paper discusses the potential impact of the proposed methodology on productivity, which suggests that it could also belong to the Multi-Agent Systems (cs.MA) category.
